cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 240 mi W of Ft. Myers, Florida and 315 mi N of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving south-southeast over the east-central Gulf of Mexico and forecast to continue south-southeast, weakening to a remnant low before reaching land
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall expected – system should remain over the Gulf and dissipate

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Scattered heavy-rain impacts possible over the central and southern Florida Peninsula; greatest effects west and south of Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely but possible in localized downpours
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible; tropical-storm-force winds improbable at PortMiami
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches with isolated higher totals; brief urban/poor-drainage flooding possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief lightning-producing squalls and reduced visibility during heavy showers could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements
